page.title: 04Trade
page.content: Before the manor and Garden Centre was built it was an arable farm,which sold fruit and ready picked vegetables. In 1959 the present owner bought the twenty-three acres of ground which the centre is set out on.There are sixty people working at the nursery. In the whole of the garden centre and nurserys they only sell pot plants and beding. During the course of the year there are thirty different types of plants grown. The most popular being Chrysanthemums. The garden centre lets four other companies rent their land to sell fruit and vegtables and garden items.Set in the middle of the centre is a shop which sells sweets,honey and jam.The centre sells direct to major stores especially in London where the centre ha its own stall at Covent Gardens.
